Jason Nesmith.Action: Looks around the command deck worried, almost sniffing the air, showing concern and awareness of the situation.
Orders to check for ambient energy fields and insists on rechecking when initial scan shows nothing, demonstrating persistence and attention to detail.
Recognizes the situation as a trap only after an explosion occurs, indicating a delayed situational assessment.
Pauses to consider the situation carefully before giving orders.
Commands activation of the Omega 13 device decisively under pressure.
Displays melodramatic emotions on face rather than purely calm, tactical demeanor.
Schedules a fan appearance without informing the rest of the cast, breaking their pact to stick together.
Is repeatedly late, causing frustration among his co-actors.
Shows apparent disregard for others' feelings, as indicated by Tommy's comment that he only cares about himself.
Schedules a fan appearance without informing the rest of the cast, breaking their pact to stick together.
Is an hour and a half late to the event, showing disregard for others' time and commitments.
Previously tried to kill off a popular character played by a fellow actor, indicating selfishness and poor team collaboration.

Flicks Dusty’s newspaper and reads over his shoulder without asking.
Acknowledges the group’s glare and asks what he did wrong, showing some awareness and openness.
Arrives confidently and cheerfully, attempts to lighten the mood with charm and humor, notices and comments on a physical irregularity on Alexander.
Flicks Dusty’s newspaper and reads over his shoulder without asking, showing casual disregard for personal boundaries.
Kisses Gwen on the cheek uninvited, causing others to glare at him, indicating a lack of social awareness.
Dismisses fans' garage set and minimizes his participation, showing little appreciation for others' efforts.
Expresses desire to work together with the group, even if not always possible.
Minimizes the importance of fan efforts and the set, showing dismissiveness and lack of appreciation for teamwork.
Refuses to fully commit to group appearances, causing tension with teammates.

Wrestles playfully with Alexander backstage, encouraging him to go on stage despite Alexander's reluctance.
Insists 'The show must go on' to Alexander, showing determination but also pressure.

Engages in physical struggle rather than calm negotiation to resolve conflict with Alexander.
Raises his hands like a conductor, encouraging the fans to cry out in unison with the show’s rallying cry.

Smiles and talks dramatically to fans, emphasizing loyalty and leadership as important qualities.
Bored with fans' constant questions, but still smiles back at Gwen.
Ignores Brandon's serious question, leaving him frustrated.
Talks dramatically and confidently to fans, showing leadership qualities and engaging with them effectively.
Appears self-absorbed and somewhat oblivious to others' reactions, smiling back at Gwen unaware she is mocking him.
Interrupts a serious discussion by standing and leaving while still focused on Gwen, ignoring the important dispute Brandon wants settled.
Admits he is not great with small stuff but would be there for Jake if he really needed him.
Fails to attend Jake's birthday despite knowing about it and Jake's support for him.
Is genuinely stunned and affected upon learning of Jake's death, showing sincere remorse.
Sidles up to the nerd girl and makes a light, somewhat dismissive comment about Gwen's denial.
Admits he is not great with small stuff but claims he would be there for big stuff, showing some self-awareness and confidence in his priorities.
Forgets to attend Jake's birthday despite Jake's support and ultimately fails to be there for him before his death, indicating a lack of attentiveness and follow-through.
Is genuinely stunned and affected by the news of Jake's death, showing emotional responsiveness and some depth.
Avoids confrontation and walks away after being confronted by Gwen about his failings, which may indicate avoidance rather than addressing issues directly.
Pushes past enthusiastic fans without response and takes refuge in the men's room.

Responds to a fan's detailed question with irritation and dismissiveness.
Pushes past fans without response and isolates himself to think.

Pushes past the aliens without listening, saying 'NOT. NOW.'

Dismisses the urgent approach of the aliens without listening, pushing past them rudely.
Sits alone drinking scotch and zoning out while watching old episodes, showing disengagement and possible escapism.
Shuts the door in the aliens' faces despite their earnest plea for help.
After initial reluctance, recognizes the aliens' request and invites them in, apologizing and showing willingness to help.
Initially ignores and shuts the door on the aliens despite their urgent plea.
After a moment of mental effort, recalls the situation and agrees to help, showing some recognition and acceptance of responsibility.
Responds politely to the aliens' honor with a casual thanks, showing some appreciation.
Hunts under his couch for a shoe, showing a distracted, informal side but no warmth indicator.
Half-asleep, asks for a Coke when asked about requirements, showing a lack of engagement or seriousness.
Interrupts Teb to ask about another alien who doesn’t talk, showing some curiosity or impatience.
Tells Teb he’s going to shut his eyes but to keep talking, then falls asleep, showing dismissiveness or lack of respect.
Hunts under his couch for a missing shoe, appearing distracted and unprepared when aliens arrive.
Responds to aliens' formal greeting with casual, distracted remarks and humor, showing lack of seriousness.
Half-asleep and inattentive during important briefing about historical situation and mission details.
Accepts being woken and tries to reorient himself quickly when called to command deck, showing some ability to respond when needed.
Jokes with the navigator to lighten the mood despite tense situation.
Declines to wear the uniform, citing personal schedule.
Understands the briefing quickly and summarizes the enemy clearly.
Declines to wear the uniform citing a personal engagement, showing prioritization but possibly lack of full engagement.

Responds to a tense negotiation with blase, dismissive commands and abruptly leaves the scene, ignoring the gravity of the situation and the concerns of others.

Ignores the concerns and questions of Betzalar about the negotiation and potential consequences, showing disregard for others' feelings and the situation's seriousness.
Responds to Sarris's demands by immediately ordering a full attack and then abruptly leaves the negotiation scene without waiting for results or coordinating further.

Leaves the aliens and is surprised and alone in the docking bay, showing no indication of concern or farewell.
Thanks Betzalar politely and accepts the interstellar vox device without hesitation.
Leaves himself alone in a strange room with no visible doors or apparent means of escape.
Fails to anticipate or prevent being encased and launched into space, showing lack of situational awareness.
Stands in shock and shivers from incomprehension after a traumatic experience, showing vulnerability.
Arrives late and disheveled to the computer store event, appearing intense and less cavalier than usual.
Stands frozen in shock and incomprehension after a traumatic experience, unable to move from the spot.

Shares his incredible experience openly and tries to convince others by showing proof, inviting them to join him on a mission to save a civilization.
Pleading sincerely with Gwen to believe him about the situation.
Smiling supportively at Gwen's smart communication with the alien voice.
Acknowledges the need for help but insists on his own capability, showing determination.
Invites Gwen to his house to show her the transport pod and encourages her to decide for herself.
Takes charge of the communication by confidently speaking into the vox and directing the other side to perform a demonstration.

Refuses help despite Gwen’s suggestion, showing overconfidence or possible denial of his limitations.

Quickly walks away after apologizing, showing little engagement or concern for the group.
Notices the Vox device labeled as Brandon's property but chooses not to return it, shrugging it off.

Runs into a group of fans and apologizes briefly but then quickly leaves without engaging further.
Notices the Vox device is property of a fan but decides not to return it, prioritizing his schedule over responsibility.
Prepares his uniform carefully and methodically, showing attention to detail and readiness.
Shows disappointment when friends do not show up, indicating some emotional vulnerability but also a sense of commitment to the event.
Appears with a big warm smile and enthusiastically welcomes the visitors, offering a grand tour despite their fear.

Admits ignorance about their exact location but offers to show it on a map.
Leads the group to see the ship with a twinkle in his eye, sharing the wonder and excitement.

Stands smiling proudly as others laugh, showing confidence and pride in the situation.

Returns salute to two hundred crewmen and commands 'At ease men' confidently.

Tries to get critical information about the Omega 13 device before a dangerous situation.

Recognizes the presence of a wall in the darkness and communicates this clearly to the team.

Leads the team efficiently under pressure, communicates clearly, and coordinates actions to defend the ship.

Smiles intensely and joyfully to encourage crew during crisis.

Reassures crew despite damage to ship, maintaining calm and trust.
Confidently commands full speed ahead despite enemy fire, successfully maneuvers the ship into a minefield to evade pursuer.

Commands the crew decisively during battle, showing trust in their abilities.
Commands the ship to swing around and orders the crew to ready the gannet cannons, then confidently orders to fire at the enemy ship.
Maintains composure and takes decisive action despite the ship's rear armor being destroyed.

Asks crew if anyone objects to going through the black hole, showing consideration for their opinions.
Leads the crew in celebrating their victory and shows concern for injured crew member Betzalar, helping him to the captain’s chair.

Confidently agrees to navigate through a black hole despite the obvious danger, showing decisiveness and willingness to take risks.

Commands the crew to slow down the ship and calculate the impact point while ensuring injured are secured after exiting the black hole.
Dismisses Alexander's warning about a strange energy surge from the enemy ship, saying 'No time to worry about that.'
Notices Dusty entering the cabin and attempts to address his presence calmly before the threat emerges.
Looks into Gwen's eyes as she dies and yells grief-stricken, then struggles to drag himself forward despite severe injury.
Despite being shot and severely wounded, he struggles to rise and drags himself toward the front of the room, showing determination and effort under extreme physical duress.
Initially stumbles weakly after being shot and collapses to the ground, unable to immediately continue fighting or leading.
Despite being bloody, weak, and barely alive, stands and takes responsibility to activate the Omega 13 to save everyone.
Nods a respectful goodbye to the others before pulling the switch, showing consideration and respect for his team.

Jason pulls the lever on the Omega 13 at the last moment before impact, successfully reversing time and saving everyone.
Jason nods a respectful goodbye to the others before activating the device, demonstrating leadership and acceptance of responsibility.
Jason looks disoriented after the time reset, taking a moment to register the situation, indicating some initial confusion.

Commands the crew firmly to stay put and orders Tommy to slow the ship, taking charge in a dangerous situation.
Engages in combat with Sarris to protect the crew and ship, showing willingness to confront danger.
Immediately recognizes and neutralizes the disguised enemy (Sarris) by physically overpowering him and taking control of the situation.
Commands the crew confidently to stay put and gives clear orders to slow the ship and reverse engines despite the chaos.
Ignores warnings about the ship's speed and potential danger, walking across the room without apparent concern.
Engages in hand-to-hand combat with a dangerous enemy, showing physical bravery and skill.

Rambling and incoherent description of his space trip, imploring fellow actors to join.

Rambling and incoherent when describing a trip to outer space.
